column6: Hello
Do we start the discussion now or wait?
Welcome, Elle
hi elle
Hello
Hi!
definitely a different exercise from the last one.

What is everyone thinking?  It looks like only one option is under budget, yet it is not viable because of the waste associated with coal.  I like plan 2, but there were some issues raised about migratory patterns of birds being affected by the wind energy.  Thoughts?
I'm leaning towards 2
honestly wind is a very low killer of birds when you look at the statistics
and there are several steps you can take to reduce fatalities
That's what I think as well.  To me, nuclear is too dangerous to be the primary source.  Hydro appears to be too costly.
my only reservation before was wind's not good without a good energy storage method for a base power supply, but a multi faceted approach leaves room for a base power supply
Welcome, FalloutBuddy
I think nuclear's quite safe, but it depends on the nuclear, I think most when they talk about this refer to traditional uranium light water reactors.
otherwise I'd be all aboard for thorium or lockheed's fusion reactors
Welcome, Goose
Hello all. I just got in. All for wind energy press 1 all for others press 0. please, thanks.
